_meta.description: Broadway show metadata - source of truth for all shows

shows.title: Two Strangers (Carry a Cake Across New York)
shows.synopsis: A new musical comedy about two strangers who meet on the streets of New York City when Robin agrees to help Dougal carry a cake across town. As they navigate the city together, unexpected connection and romance bloom in this charming, laugh-filled love story celebrating chance encounters and the magic of New York.

shows.title: Maybe Happy Ending
shows.synopsis: In a future where robots have become obsolete, two helper-bots discover what it means to be human through an unexpected connection. Winner of six 2025 Tony Awards including Best Musical.

shows.title: The Outsiders
shows.synopsis: Based on S.E. Hinton's classic novel, this electrifying new musical follows the Greasers and Socs in 1967 Tulsa as they navigate loyalty, love, and the struggle to belong. Winner of the 2024 Tony Award for Best Musical.

shows.title: Hell's Kitchen
shows.synopsis: A new musical featuring the songs of 16-time Grammy Award winner Alicia Keys. Set in 1990s New York, a 17-year-old girl dreams of a life beyond her Hell's Kitchen block.

shows.title: Operation Mincemeat
shows.synopsis: The Olivier Award-winning Best New Musical tells the outrageous true story of the WWII plot to fool Hitler with a corpse, fake documents, and an idealistic intelligence team.

shows.title: Oh, Mary!
shows.synopsis: Cole Escola's uproarious comedy imagines Mary Todd Lincoln as a miserable, hard-drinking woman who dreams of becoming a cabaret star while her husband prepares for that fateful night at Ford's Theatre.

shows.title: The Great Gatsby
shows.synopsis: F. Scott Fitzgerald's iconic novel roars to life in this dazzling new musical. Jay Gatsby throws lavish parties in pursuit of his lost love, Daisy Buchanan, in the glittering Jazz Age.

shows.title: Bug
shows.synopsis: Tracy Letts' psychological thriller makes its Broadway premiere. In a seedy Oklahoma motel, an unexpected romance between a lonely waitress and mysterious drifter twists into paranoia and delusion.

shows.title: Wicked
shows.synopsis: The untold story of the Witches of Oz. Long before Dorothy arrives, Elphaba and Glinda meet as sorcery students and form an unlikely friendship that will change the land of Oz forever.

shows.title: Hamilton
shows.synopsis: The story of America's Founding Father Alexander Hamilton, an immigrant from the West Indies who became George Washington's right-hand man and the nation's first Treasury Secretary.

shows.title: The Lion King
shows.synopsis: Disney's award-winning musical brings the African savanna to Broadway with stunning puppetry and masks. Young Simba must embrace his destiny to become king after tragedy strikes the Pride Lands.

shows.title: Chicago
shows.synopsis: Set in the legendary city during the roaring twenties, Chicago tells the story of Roxie Hart, a housewife who murders her lover and convinces her husband to take the fall. The longest-running American musical in Broadway history.

shows.title: Moulin Rouge! The Musical
shows.synopsis: Enter a world of splendor and romance, of eye-popping excess, of glitz, grandeur and glory! A world where Bohemians and aristocrats rub elbows and revel in electrifying enchantment.

shows.title: Aladdin
shows.synopsis: Disney's thrilling adaptation of the animated classic. From the producer of The Lion King comes the story of a street-smart young man who discovers a magic lamp and genie.

creativeTeam.name: Howard Ashman, Tim Rice & Chad Beguelin

shows.title: Hadestown
shows.synopsis: Welcome to Hadestown, where a song can change your fate. This acclaimed new musical by Anaïs Mitchell intertwines two mythic tales — that of Orpheus and Eurydice, and King Hades and his wife Persephone.

shows.title: MJ The Musical
shows.synopsis: The story of Michael Jackson, centering around the making of his 1992 Dangerous World Tour, revealing the creative mind and collaborative spirit that catapulted him into legendary status.

shows.title: SIX
shows.synopsis: The six wives of Henry VIII take the mic to tell their own stories and reclaim their identities in this electrifying pop concert musical.

shows.title: The Book of Mormon
shows.synopsis: From the creators of South Park comes this hilarious musical about two mismatched Mormon missionaries sent to spread the word in a remote Ugandan village.

creativeTeam.name: Trey Parker, Robert Lopez & Matt Stone

shows.title: & Juliet
shows.synopsis: What if Juliet's story didn't end in tragedy? This joyful jukebox musical featuring Max Martin's iconic pop hits reimagines Shakespeare's heroine as she writes her own destiny.

shows.title: Oedipus
shows.synopsis: A new adaptation of Sophocles' masterpiece starring Rami Malek and Indira Varma. When a plague devastates Thebes, King Oedipus discovers the shocking truth about his origins.

creativeTeam.name: Jesse Berger and starring the incomparable Patrick Page as Titus
Tony Award nominee Leigh Silverman that explores the fine line between fascination and obsession
Winnie Holzman based on the novel by Gregory Maguire
Franklin Shepard and his two lifelong friends

shows.title: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child
shows.synopsis: Nineteen years after Harry's original adventure, he's now a Ministry of Magic employee while his son Albus struggles with the family legacy at Hogwarts.

shows.title: Mamma Mia!
shows.synopsis: ABBA's hits tell the story of a young woman's search for her birth father on a Greek island paradise. A sunny, funny tale of love, laughter and friendship.

shows.title: Stranger Things: The First Shadow
shows.synopsis: Hawkins, 1959: A regular American town where nothing strange happens. Until a young student arrives, fleeing the horrors of childhood, and everything changes. The prequel to the hit Netflix series.

shows.title: Cabaret at the Kit Kat Club
shows.synopsis: Willkommen to the Kit Kat Club! This immersive, Tony-winning revival transforms the theater into a 1930s Berlin nightclub. Starring Eddie Redmayne as the Emcee.

creativeTeam.name: Meghann Zervoulis Bate and                                                 Anessa Marie Scolpini

shows.title: Stereophonic
shows.synopsis: Set in a 1970s recording studio, this Pulitzer Prize-winning play follows a rock band creating their masterpiece as personal tensions threaten to tear them apart.

shows.title: Water for Elephants
shows.synopsis: Based on the bestselling novel, this Depression-era love story unfolds at a traveling circus where a young veterinarian falls for the star performer.

shows.title: Suffs
shows.synopsis: The story of the American women's suffrage movement, following Alice Paul and her fellow suffragettes as they fight for the 19th Amendment.

shows.title: The Notebook
shows.synopsis: Based on Nicholas Sparks' beloved novel, this musical tells the epic love story of Noah and Allie across decades, featuring three couples at different stages of their relationship.

creativeTeam.name: David Zinn and Brett J. Banakis

shows.title: Marjorie Prime
shows.synopsis: In the near future, a woman in her eighties named Marjorie spends time with a holographic projection of her late husband. As her memory fades, her family grapples with what it means to remember and be remembered.

shows.title: Liberation
shows.synopsis: A powerful drama exploring themes of freedom and identity.

shows.title: Boop! The Musical
shows.synopsis: Betty Boop makes her Broadway debut in this new musical celebrating the iconic cartoon character.

shows.title: The Queen of Versailles
shows.synopsis: Based on the documentary film, this musical tells the story of Jackie Siegel and her family's quest to build the largest house in America.

creativeTeam.name: Lauren Yalango-Grant and                                     Christopher Cree Grant

shows.title: Death Becomes Her
shows.synopsis: Based on the cult classic film, two rivals discover a magical potion that promises eternal youth, with hilarious and deadly consequences.

shows.title: Buena Vista Social Club
shows.synopsis: A musical celebration of the legendary Cuban musicians who came together to record the Grammy-winning album.

shows.title: Ragtime
shows.synopsis: The sweeping musical about three families in turn-of-the-century America returns to Broadway.

shows.title: Chess
shows.synopsis: The Cold War chess musical with music by ABBA's Benny Andersson and Björn Ulvaeus finally arrives on Broadway.

shows.title: Just in Time
shows.synopsis: A new musical celebrating the life and music of Dean Martin.

shows.title: The Roommate
shows.synopsis: A play by Jen Silverman starring Patti LuPone and Mia Farrow as unlikely roommates.

shows.title: Our Town
shows.synopsis: Thornton Wilders beloved American classic starring Jim Parsons and Katie Holmes.

shows.title: Back to the Future: The Musical
shows.synopsis: Based on the iconic 1985 film, Marty McFly travels back in time in the DeLorean.

shows.title: Every Brilliant Thing

shows.synopsis: Beaches, A New Musical, based on the best-selling novel that became the blockbuster film, brings to the stage one of the most iconic friendships in popular culture. This sweeping, emotional, and joy-filled new musical follows the vivacious Cee Cee and elegant Bertie, who meet as children and become fast friends. And now CATS: The Jellicle Ball ascends to Broadway in a kaleidoscope of glittering spectacle, iconic music and electrifying ballroom choreography that The New York Times calls “a lightning strike that sets joy free!”Broadway meets Runway i

shows.title: The Fear of 13
shows.synopsis: The Fear of 13 tells the extraordinary true story of Nick Yarris, who spends more than  two decades on death row for a murder he insists he did not commit. Through a series  of prison visits with a volunteer named Jackie, Nick traces a life shaped by impulse and  consequence. As Nick and Jackie’s conversations deepen, the line between witness  and participant blurs, forcing both to confront what justice demands, what belief  requires, and the perilous distance between true freedom and the illusi

shows.title: Proof
shows.synopsis: "Proof" is a captivating musical that delves into the complex relationship between a brilliant but troubled mathematician and his equally gifted daughter. As she grapples with the burden of her father's genius and mental illness, the young woman must confront her own doubts and fears to uncover a groundbreaking mathematical proof hidden within her father's notebooks. Blending heart-wrenching drama with moments of poignant humor, "Proof" explores the universal themes of family, legacy, and the pursuit of truth.

shows.title: The Rocky Horror Show
shows.synopsis: Filled with fun, frolics and frocks, this is the show the Daily Telegraph calls “fresh, subversive, and essential.”

shows.title: Titanique
shows.synopsis: Watch Dion (Mindelle) crash a tour group at a Titanic museum to tell them what really happened to Jack and Rose — and it's not how Hollywood tells it. The whole thing is set to Dion's hits (including, of course, "My Heart Will Go On") and a nonstop wave of movie spoofs and up-to-the-minute pop culture jokes.

Winnie Holzman based on the novel by Gregory Maguire
Franklin Shepard and his two lifelong friends

shows.title: All Out: Comedy About Ambition
shows.synopsis: From the writer of last year's runaway hit, All In: Comedy About Love, comes All Out: Comedy About Ambition. Here's how it works: a group of the funniest people on earth gather on Broadway (four at a time) to read hilarious stories by Simon Rich about ego, envy, greed, and basically just New Yorkers in general.

shows.title: Real Women Have Curves
shows.synopsis: Based on the beloved play and film, this new musical follows Ana, a first-generation Mexican-American teenager in East LA, torn between her dreams of going to college and her family's expectations. With an original Latin pop-infused score, it's a joyful celebration of family, identity, and self-acceptance.

shows.title: Redwood
shows.synopsis: After her son's death, Jesse leaves her wife and work, drives across the US to the redwood forest, and forms a profound relationship with a giant redwood tree. Inspired by the life of Julia Butterfly Hill, this new musical explores grief, connection, and the healing power of nature.

shows.title: Days of Wine and Roses
shows.synopsis: A new musical adaptation of the classic 1962 film about two people who fall in love and descend into alcoholism together. With music by Adam Guettel and book by Craig Lucas.

shows.title: Harmony
shows.synopsis: The story of the Comedian Harmonists, a singing group in 1920s and 30s Germany who became international stars before being silenced by the Nazi regime.

shows.title: Here Lies Love
shows.synopsis: An immersive dance-floor musical experience about the rise and fall of Imelda Marcos, First Lady of the Philippines. Features music by David Byrne and Fatboy Slim.

shows.title: How to Dance in Ohio
shows.synopsis: Based on the documentary, this groundbreaking musical follows seven autistic young adults preparing for their first spring formal dance. Historic for featuring autistic actors in all seven lead roles.

shows.title: Illinoise
shows.synopsis: A dance musical set to Sufjan Stevens' iconic album 'Illinois', telling stories of love, loss, and hope through breathtaking choreography.

shows.title: Lempicka
shows.synopsis: The story of bold Art Deco painter Tamara de Lempicka, exploring her artistic ambition, passionate love affairs, and escape from war-torn Europe.

shows.title: Once Upon a One More Time
shows.synopsis: A jukebox musical featuring the songs of Britney Spears, where fairy tale princesses discover feminism and rewrite their own stories.

shows.title: The Heart of Rock and Roll
shows.synopsis: A jukebox musical featuring the songs of Huey Lewis and the News, following Bobby who must choose between his rock star dreams and a stable job.

shows.title: Gutenberg! The Musical!
shows.synopsis: A two-man comedy musical about aspiring playwrights who present their ridiculous musical about Johannes Gutenberg using hats to play all the characters.

shows.title: Merrily We Roll Along
shows.synopsis: Sondheim's musical told in reverse, following three friends—a composer, a playwright, and a writer—from middle-age success back to their hopeful youth. Tony-winning 2023 revival.

shows.title: Spamalot
shows.synopsis: The Tony Award-winning musical comedy lovingly ripped off from Monty Python and the Holy Grail, following King Arthur and his knights on their quest for the Holy Grail.

shows.title: The Who's Tommy
shows.synopsis: A deaf, dumb, and blind boy becomes a pinball champion in this rock opera. The acclaimed revival directed by Des McAnuff featuring The Who's iconic score.

shows.title: The Wiz
shows.synopsis: The Tony-winning African American retelling of The Wizard of Oz with a soulful R&B score. Starring Wayne Brady and Deborah Cox.

shows.title: Grey House
shows.synopsis: A horror play about a couple who crashes their car in the mountains and seeks shelter in a cabin, only to discover terrifying secrets within.

shows.title: I Need That
shows.synopsis: A darkly comic new play about a man buried alive in his stuff and the estranged family members trying to help him.

shows.title: Jaja's African Hair Braiding
shows.synopsis: A vibrant comedy set in a Harlem hair braiding salon on the hottest day of summer, where the lives of West African immigrant women intertwine.

shows.title: Just for Us
shows.synopsis: Alex Edelman's solo show about accidentally attending a secret gathering of white supremacists, blending comedy with sharp social commentary.

shows.title: Mary Jane
shows.synopsis: A profound drama about a single mother caring for her medically fragile son, finding community among the nurses, therapists, and caregivers who help her.

shows.title: Mother Play
shows.synopsis: Paula Vogel's autobiographical memory play exploring her complicated relationship with her mother through decades of family history.

shows.title: Patriots
shows.synopsis: A political thriller about Boris Berezovsky's role in Vladimir Putin's rise to power, and the oligarch's subsequent fall from grace.

shows.title: Prayer for the French Republic
shows.synopsis: An epic family drama spanning generations, exploring the lives of a Jewish family in France grappling with rising antisemitism and questions of identity.

shows.title: The Cottage
shows.synopsis: A farce set in 1920s England where a wife's infidelity is discovered, leading to a cascade of comic revelations and twists.

shows.title: The Shark Is Broken
shows.synopsis: A behind-the-scenes comedy about the chaotic filming of Jaws, as three actors stuck on a boat deal with mechanical failures and clashing egos.

shows.title: An Enemy of the People
shows.synopsis: Ibsen's classic play about a doctor who discovers the town's water supply is contaminated and faces fierce opposition when trying to expose the truth.

shows.title: Appropriate
shows.synopsis: Three estranged siblings reunite to settle their late father's estate in Arkansas, where a disturbing discovery forces them to confront dark family secrets.

shows.title: Doubt: A Parable
shows.synopsis: A nun becomes suspicious of a priest's relationship with a young student at a Bronx Catholic school in this Pulitzer Prize-winning drama.

shows.title: Purlie Victorious: A Non-Confederate Romp Through the Cotton Patch
shows.synopsis: A satirical comedy about a self-appointed preacher returning to the Georgia town of his youth to claim the inheritance of his aunt, integrating the church and reclaiming land.

shows.title: Uncle Vanya
shows.synopsis: Chekhov's masterpiece about a family gathering at a rural estate where simmering resentments and unrequited loves come to the surface.

shows.title: Home
shows.synopsis: In "Home," a family grapples with the weight of their shared past as they gather to celebrate their matriarch's birthday. Tensions rise and long-buried secrets threaten to unravel the delicate fabric of their relationships. As they confront the complexities of their lives, the family must decide whether to let go of the past or find the courage to forge a new path forward, together.

shows.title: JOB
shows.synopsis: "JOB" is a captivating Broadway play that takes audiences on a profound journey through the life of the biblical figure, Job. Faced with a series of devastating trials, Job grapples with his faith, testing the boundaries of divine justice and human resilience. This gripping production blends timeless themes of suffering and redemption, delivering a thought-provoking exploration of the human condition that will leave a lasting impact on theatergoers.

shows.title: Once Upon a Mattress
shows.synopsis: "Once Upon a Mattress" is a delightful musical romp that reimagines the classic fairy tale of "The Princess and the Pea." Feisty Princess Winnifred shakes up the kingdom as she competes for the hand of the shy Prince Dauntless, much to the dismay of his overbearing mother, Queen Aggravain. With witty dialogue, catchy tunes, and a touch of slapstick humor, this enchanting production keeps audiences enthralled as it weaves a charming tale of love, laughter, and the power of being true to oneself.

creativeTeam.name: Jay Thompson, Marshall Barer and Dean Fuller

shows.title: The Hills of California
shows.synopsis: The Hills of California follows the riveting tale of a family's struggle to preserve their ancestral vineyard amidst the rapidly changing landscape of modern California. As they navigate the complexities of tradition, progress, and personal dreams, the family's bonds are tested, leading to a captivating exploration of the delicate balance between preserving the past and embracing the future.

shows.title: McNeal
shows.synopsis: "McNeal" captivates audiences with its gripping exploration of one man's struggle for redemption. In the heart of New York City, a former Wall Street titan navigates a web of personal and professional conflicts, grappling with the consequences of his past choices. Audiences are taken on a powerful journey, where the lines between ambition, morality, and the pursuit of second chances are masterfully blurred, leaving them both entertained and deeply moved.

shows.title: Yellow Face
shows.synopsis: "Yellow Face" is a captivating exploration of identity, race, and the complexities of cultural belonging. When a playwright accidentally casts a white actor in an Asian role, he finds himself at the center of a media firestorm, forced to confront his own assumptions about race and representation. As the story unfolds, audiences are taken on a thought-provoking journey that challenges preconceptions and delves into the nuances of identity in a diverse, ever-changing society.

shows.title: Sunset Boulevard
shows.synopsis: In the glitz and glamour of 1950s Hollywood, a struggling screenwriter stumbles upon the forgotten mansion of a reclusive silent film star, Norma Desmond. Captivated by her faded glory, he becomes ensnared in her obsession to make a comeback, leading them on a twisted path of manipulation, desperation, and the ultimate demise of their doomed romance. "Sunset Boulevard" is a haunting, atmospheric musical that delves into the dark underbelly of the entertainment industry, where dreams and illusions collide with devastating consequences.

creativeTeam.name: David Cullen and Andrew Lloyd Webber

shows.title: Left on Tenth
shows.synopsis: In the heart of New York City, a powerful story unfolds on the stage of the James Earl Jones Theatre. "Left on Tenth" follows the lives of a group of unlikely friends as they navigate the challenges of love, loss, and the search for meaning in a bustling metropolis. With a poignant blend of humor and raw emotion, this captivating play takes the audience on a journey that explores the resilience of the human spirit and the enduring connections that can be found in the most unexpected places.

shows.title: Romeo + Juliet
shows.synopsis: In modern-day California, two teenagers from feuding families, Romeo and Juliet, fall passionately in love. Their forbidden romance leads them on a dangerous path, as they are forced to navigate their families' long-standing feud and the social pressures that threaten to tear them apart. Amidst the vibrant, neon-lit backdrop of Verona Beach, the young lovers embark on a desperate and heart-wrenching journey, risking everything for a chance at a future together.

shows.title: A Wonderful World: The Louis Armstrong Musical
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: "A Wonderful World: The Louis Armstrong Musical" transports audiences into the life and times of the iconic jazz legend. Through soulful melodies and captivating performances, the show chronicles Armstrong's journey from a young street performer to a global superstar, exploring the triumphs and challenges that shape his remarkable career and enduring legacy as a musical pioneer and cultural icon.

creativeTeam.name: Christina Sajous and James Monroe Iglehart
Clarence Muse, Leon René, Otis René and Spencer Williams

shows.title: Tammy Faye
shows.synopsis: In the captivating musical "Tammy Faye," audiences are swept into the extraordinary life of the beloved televangelist. Navigating the highs and lows of fame, Tammy Faye's unwavering faith and infectious charisma captivate a nation, even as she confronts the scandals that threaten to tear her world apart. With a powerful score and a remarkable performance, this poignant tale explores the complexities of love, redemption, and the enduring power of the human spirit.

shows.title: Elf
shows.synopsis: Buddy, a human raised by elves, embarks on a whimsical journey to New York City to find his birth father and discover his true identity. As he navigates the bustling streets and encounters the cynical world of adults, Buddy's infectious enthusiasm and childlike wonder bring joy and laughter, transforming the lives of those around him and reminding everyone of the true spirit of Christmas.

shows.title: Swept Away
shows.synopsis: "Swept Away" is a captivating musical that takes audiences on a whirlwind journey of love and survival. When a group of strangers are stranded on a remote island after a shipwreck, they must navigate the challenges of the wilderness and their own personal relationships. As they fight to escape the island, they discover that the true treasure lies not in the sand, but in the connections they forge with one another.

shows.title: Cult of Love
shows.synopsis: Cult of Love follows the captivating journey of a young woman who becomes entangled in the seductive allure of a mysterious cult. As she navigates the intoxicating web of the cult's beliefs and rituals, she must confront the line between personal freedom and the pull of unwavering devotion. This gripping exploration of human nature and the power of belief keeps audiences on the edge of their seats.

shows.title: Eureka Day
shows.synopsis: In the heart of a progressive community, the parents of Eureka Day School must navigate the complexities of a measles outbreak. As they grapple with conflicting beliefs and values, tensions rise, and the search for consensus becomes a fierce battleground. With sharp wit and keen insight, this timely play explores the challenges of maintaining unity in the face of growing division.

shows.title: Gypsy
shows.synopsis: "Gypsy" follows the ambitious stage mother Rose as she pushes her two daughters, June and Louise, to stardom in the world of vaudeville. As the sisters struggle to find their own paths, Rose's relentless drive threatens to tear their family apart. With show-stopping musical numbers and a gripping family drama, "Gypsy" explores the cost of achieving the American dream and the unbreakable bond between a mother and her children.

shows.title: All In: Comedy About Love
shows.synopsis: All In: Comedy About Love takes audiences on a hilarious journey through the highs and lows of modern relationships. As four friends navigate the unpredictable landscape of love, they find themselves caught in a web of secrets, lies, and unexpected twists that keep the audience laughing and guessing until the very end. With its witty dialogue, relatable characters, and infectious energy, this play offers a refreshing and entertaining exploration of the complexities of the human heart.

shows.title: English
shows.synopsis: "English" takes audiences on a captivating journey, where the power of language and cultural identity collide. As a diverse group of students navigate the complexities of learning a new language, they find themselves confronted with personal and societal challenges that test the boundaries of their relationships and self-discovery. Through poignant dialogue and dynamic performances, this play explores the transformative potential of communication and the universal human desire to connect across linguistic divides.

shows.title: Purpose
shows.synopsis: In "Purpose," a young woman's life is upended when she discovers a shocking family secret. As she navigates the emotional aftermath, she must confront her own beliefs and find the courage to forge a new path forward. With deeply drawn characters and a gripping narrative, this play explores the complexities of identity, the power of truth, and the universal search for purpose in the face of unexpected challenges.

shows.title: Othello
shows.synopsis: Othello, a revered Moorish general, falls victim to the manipulative schemes of his devious ensign, Iago. Consumed by jealousy and a thirst for revenge, Iago masterfully orchestrates a web of deceit that shatters Othello's trust in his beloved wife, Desdemona. As this Shakespearean tragedy unfolds, the audience is swept into a gripping tale of love, betrayal, and the catastrophic consequences of unchecked human emotions.

shows.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
shows.synopsis: A young, beautiful man named Dorian Gray strikes a Faustian bargain - his portrait will age while he remains forever youthful. As Dorian indulges in a life of hedonism and sin, his portrait becomes a mirror for his corrupted soul, leading to a chilling confrontation with his own mortality. This dark, Gothic tale of vanity and the corrupting nature of absolute beauty captivates audiences in this thrilling stage adaptation of Oscar Wilde's classic novel.

shows.title: Glengarry Glen Ross
shows.synopsis: In the cutthroat world of real estate, a group of ruthless salesmen compete for the chance to clinch the ultimate deal. As tensions rise and desperation sets in, their moral compass is tested, and they must confront the ruthless realities of their industry. "Glengarry Glen Ross" is a riveting exploration of the American dream gone awry, where the pursuit of success comes at a heavy personal cost.

shows.title: Good Night, and Good Luck
shows.synopsis: "Good Night, and Good Luck" takes audiences on a captivating journey through the high-stakes world of 1950s television. As journalist Edward R. Murrow risks his career to challenge the McCarthy era's rampant fear-mongering, the play explores the delicate balance between press freedom and political power. With its gripping narrative and powerful performances, this production transports viewers to a pivotal moment in history, where one man's courageous stand against injustice resonates with profound relevance in today's landscape.

shows.title: The Last Five Years
shows.synopsis: "The Last Five Years" is a captivating musical that takes the audience on an emotional journey through the rise and fall of a relationship. Told through the unique perspectives of two individuals, the story unfolds in reverse, creating a poignant and intricate exploration of love, loss, and the complexities of the human experience. Audiences are drawn into the powerful storytelling, which is amplified by the show's hauntingly beautiful score, leaving them deeply moved and reflecting on the fragility and resilience of the human heart.

shows.title: Stephen Sondheim's Old Friends
shows.synopsis: In "Stephen Sondheim's Old Friends," a group of longtime companions reunite, each grappling with the bittersweet realities of life, love, and the passage of time. As they reminisce and confront their pasts, the friends discover that the bonds they share run deeper than they ever imagined, leading them on a poignant and unforgettable journey of self-discovery. With Sondheim's signature wit and emotional depth, this captivating musical explores the complexities of friendship, the power of nostalgia, and the enduring resilience of the human spirit.

shows.title: SMASH
shows.synopsis: "SMASH" is a thrilling new Broadway musical that takes audiences on a captivating journey into the competitive world of musical theater. Centered around the creation of a groundbreaking new production, the show follows the personal and professional lives of a talented ensemble of writers, directors, and performers as they navigate the high-stakes, cutthroat environment of the industry. With electrifying performances and a compelling narrative, "SMASH" offers a compelling and authentic glimpse into the dreams, rivalries, and sacrifices that define the pursuit of theatrical stardom.

shows.title: John Proctor is the Villain
shows.synopsis: In the gripping drama "John Proctor is the Villain," the infamous Salem witch trials take a surprising twist. When a young woman accuses Proctor, a respected farmer, of witchcraft, he must confront his own dark past and the community's thirst for vengeance. As the stakes rise and tensions boil, Proctor finds himself at the center of a dangerous game of deceit and retribution, forcing him to make a choice that will shape the course of history.

shows.title: Floyd Collins
shows.synopsis: In the depths of a Kentucky cave, a man named Floyd Collins is trapped, sparking a media frenzy and a desperate race against time to save him. As the world watches, Floyd's family and the local community grapple with the weight of the tragedy, their emotions and relationships tested by the unfolding drama. "Floyd Collins" is a haunting and poignant musical that explores the human spirit's resilience in the face of unimaginable adversity.

shows.title: Pirates! The Penzance Musical
shows.synopsis: In the rollicking musical "Pirates! The Penzance Musical," a young man named Frederic is mistakenly apprenticed to a band of bumbling pirates, leading to a hilarious clash of duty and desire as he falls for the beautiful Mabel and must choose between his love and his loyalty. With swashbuckling adventure, soaring music, and a heart-warming story, this lighthearted production at the Todd Haimes Theatre promises a delightful evening of pure theatrical enchantment.

shows.title: Dead Outlaw
shows.synopsis: In the Wild West, a notorious outlaw is gunned down, but his spirit lingers, seeking vengeance. As the townsfolk grapple with his dark legacy, a young widow must confront the past and find the courage to forge her own path. With thrilling musical numbers and a hauntingly beautiful score, "Dead Outlaw" weaves a captivating tale of redemption, the power of the human spirit, and the echoes of the past that shape the future.

creativeTeam.name: Erik Della Penna, Dean Sharenow and David Yazbek
David Yazbek and Erik Della Penna
David Yazbek and Erik Della Penna

shows.title: The Kite Runner
shows.synopsis: "The Kite Runner" is a poignant tale of friendship, betrayal, and redemption, set against the backdrop of a turbulent Afghanistan. As childhood friends Amir and Hassan navigate the complexities of their social divide, a devastating act of cowardice haunts them, leading Amir on a journey of self-discovery and the chance to right the wrongs of the past. This powerful story of loyalty, guilt, and the human capacity for both cruelty and compassion unfolds on the stage, captivating audiences with its emotional depth and timely relevance.

shows.title: Into the Woods
shows.synopsis: In the enchanting musical "Into the Woods," a baker and his wife embark on a magical journey, navigating the intertwining stories of classic fairy tale characters. As they traverse the mysterious woods, they encounter a cast of captivating characters, each with their own wishes and desires, leading to a thrilling exploration of the consequences of those wishes. With its blend of humor, heartbreak, and fairy tale wonder, "Into the Woods" weaves a spellbinding tale that delights audiences of all ages.

shows.title: Leopoldstadt
shows.synopsis: "Leopoldstadt" is a haunting exploration of a Jewish family's generational journey through the tumultuous 20th century. Spanning decades, the play delves into the personal lives and historical upheavals that reshape their identity and connection. Audiences are immersed in a poignant tale of love, loss, and the resilience of the human spirit as this family navigates the changing tides of a world in flux.

shows.title: Cost of Living
shows.synopsis: "Cost of Living" is a powerful exploration of the human experience, where the lives of four strangers intersect in unexpected ways. Marlee, a graduate student with cerebral palsy, and Eddie, a truck driver with a troubled past, forge an unlikely connection, while Jess, a wealthy woman, and John, her ex-husband, navigate the complexities of their relationship. As their stories unfold, the play delves into themes of disability, class, and the true cost of living, leaving audiences deeply moved and contemplating the depth of the human experience.

"1776" brings the Founding Fathers to life in a captivating musical journey. As America teeters on the brink of revolution, a group of determined men, led by John Adams, fight passionately to declare independence and shape the future of a new nation. Filled with rousing songs and rich historical drama, this Tony-winning production offers a compelling look at the birth of the United States.

creativeTeam.name: Jeffrey L. Page and Diane Paulus

shows.title: Death of a Salesman
shows.synopsis: In Arthur Miller's timeless classic "Death of a Salesman," audiences are plunged into the turbulent life of Willy Loman, a once-promising salesman whose dreams of success have crumbled. As he grapples with the harsh realities of his existence, Willy's desperate attempts to recapture the glory of the past collide with the crushing weight of the present, leading to a powerful exploration of the American Dream and the human cost of its pursuit.

shows.title: The Piano Lesson
shows.synopsis: The Piano Lesson is a powerful family drama that explores the complex legacy of slavery and the struggle to reclaim one's history. Set in 1930s Pittsburgh, the play follows the story of the Charles family, who must confront the ghosts of their past as they grapple with the fate of a cherished family heirloom - an ornately carved piano that holds the key to their ancestral story. Tensions rise as the family is forced to choose between honoring their heritage or forging a new path forward.

shows.title: Topdog / Underdog
shows.synopsis: In "Topdog/Underdog," two estranged brothers, Lincoln and Booth, navigate the complexities of their shared past and the intense rivalry that threatens to tear them apart. As they struggle to reconcile their differences and find their place in a world that seems stacked against them, the play delves into the nuances of family, identity, and the pursuit of the American Dream.

shows.title: Walking with Ghosts
shows.synopsis: "Walking with Ghosts" takes audiences on a gripping, supernatural journey as a grieving widow discovers her deceased husband's secrets. Haunted by visions and cryptic messages, she must navigate a tangled web of the past to uncover the truth and confront the spectral forces that have invaded her life. With its captivating blend of psychological thriller and ethereal mystery, this play promises to leave theatergoers on the edge of their seats.

shows.title: Almost Famous
shows.synopsis: "Almost Famous" transports audiences to the freewheeling 1970s as it follows the story of William, a young music journalist on the cusp of his big break. Thrust into the glamorous and gritty world of rock 'n' roll, William navigates the complexities of fame, friendship, and the power of music to shape a generation. With its infectious score and electrifying performances, this coming-of-age tale captures the heart and soul of a defining era.

shows.title: Kimberly Akimbo
shows.synopsis: "Kimberly Akimbo" is a heartwarming musical that follows the story of a teenager with a rare aging condition who navigates the complexities of family, friendship, and self-discovery. With a sharp wit and an unwavering spirit, Kimberly embarks on a journey to reclaim her childhood and find her place in a world that doesn't always understand her. Blending poignant drama with vibrant musical numbers, "Kimberly Akimbo" explores themes of resilience, acceptance, and the universal desire to live life to the fullest.

shows.title: Take Me Out
shows.synopsis: In "Take Me Out", a star baseball player comes out as gay, sparking a fierce debate among his teammates and the media. As tensions rise, the play delves into the complexities of sexuality, identity, and the challenges of navigating the public spotlight. With a powerful ensemble cast, "Take Me Out" explores the personal and societal implications of one man's decision to live openly in the high-stakes world of professional sports.

shows.title: Mike Birbiglia: The Old Man & The Pool
shows.synopsis: Mike Birbiglia's "The Old Man & The Pool" takes the audience on a hilarious and poignant journey as he navigates the complexities of aging, facing his fears, and finding unexpected wisdom in the most unlikely of places – a public pool. Through his signature blend of storytelling and relatable humor, Birbiglia invites us to confront our own mortality and embrace the unexpected moments that shape our lives.

shows.title: A Christmas Carol
shows.synopsis: In Charles Dickens' beloved classic, A Christmas Carol, the miserly Ebenezer Scrooge is visited by the ghosts of Christmases past, present, and yet to come, who guide him on a transformative journey of redemption. As Scrooge confronts the consequences of his selfish ways, he must choose whether to embrace the true spirit of the holiday and change his ways before it's too late. This timeless tale of hope and second chances comes to life on the Broadway stage, captivating audiences with its timeless message and enchanting theatricality.

shows.title: KPOP
shows.synopsis: "KPOP" transports audiences into the high-stakes, high-pressure world of K-pop stardom. Centered around a diverse ensemble of up-and-coming K-pop artists, the musical navigates the intense training, fierce competition, and personal sacrifices required to achieve global fame. Blending electrifying musical numbers with intimate character-driven narratives, "KPOP" offers a captivating peek behind the curtain of the K-pop industry, exploring the dreams, passions, and vulnerabilities of those striving to become the next big K-pop sensation.

shows.title: Ain't No Mo'
shows.synopsis: "Ain't No Mo'" is a bold and genre-bending theatrical experience that takes audiences on a satirical journey through the African American experience in modern-day America. Blending sketch comedy, social commentary, and powerful storytelling, the play explores the idea of a hypothetical government program that offers African Americans one-way tickets to Africa, sparking a hilarious and thought-provoking exploration of race, identity, and the complexities of the Black experience. With its sharp wit and unapologetic honesty, "Ain't No Mo'" promises to leave a lasting impact on all who witness its transformative performance.

creativeTeam.name: Jonathan Deans and Taylor J. Williams

shows.title: A Beautiful Noise, The Neil Diamond Musical
shows.synopsis: "A Beautiful Noise, The Neil Diamond Musical" transports audiences on a journey through the life and iconic songs of the legendary Neil Diamond. Blending electrifying performances with a captivating narrative, the musical explores Diamond's rise to stardom, personal triumphs, and the timeless melodies that have touched millions. With an all-star cast bringing his beloved hits to life, this Broadway event promises an unforgettable celebration of one of music's most enduring icons.

creativeTeam.name: Bob Gaudio, Sonny Paladino and Brian Usifer

shows.title: Ohio State Murders
shows.synopsis: A renowned author returns to her alma mater, Ohio State University, to deliver a lecture, but a dark secret from her past comes back to haunt her. As she unravels the mystery, the audience is taken on a captivating journey filled with twists, turns, and the haunting legacy of a tragic past. "Ohio State Murders" is a gripping psychological thriller that delves into the complexities of identity, trauma, and the power of storytelling.

shows.title: Some Like It Hot
shows.synopsis: Two struggling musicians, Joe and Jerry, witness a mob murder and must go on the run. Disguising themselves as women, they join an all-female band and end up entangled in a hilarious web of mistaken identities, high-stakes hijinks, and unexpected romance. Packed with big laughs, dazzling dance numbers, and an irresistible score, "Some Like It Hot" is a wildly entertaining musical adaptation of the classic comedy film.

shows.title: The Collaboration
shows.synopsis: "The Collaboration" transports audiences to 1980s New York, where two titans of the art world, Andy Warhol and Jean-Michel Basquiat, forge an unexpected partnership that challenges the boundaries of their creativity and personal lives. As these two visionary artists navigate the complexities of their collaboration, they confront their own demons and the changing cultural landscape, resulting in a captivating exploration of the power of art to transcend differences and forge unexpected connections.

shows.title: Between Riverside and Crazy
shows.synopsis: "Between Riverside and Crazy" is a gripping exploration of a retired police officer's fight for justice and redemption. As he navigates the complexities of his personal relationships and the legal system, he finds himself embroiled in a high-stakes battle that challenges his values and tests the limits of his resilience. With its powerful performances and thought-provoking narrative, this play takes audiences on a riveting journey that delves into the heart of social issues and the human condition.

shows.title: Pictures From Home
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: In "Pictures From Home," three generations of a family confront the complexities of their relationships and the legacy they've inherited. Through intimate, candid moments, the play explores how the past shapes the present, challenging the characters to redefine their roles and forge new connections. Directed by Bartlett Sher, this deeply personal story offers a poignant and resonant exploration of family, memory, and the power of photography to capture the essence of our lives.

creativeTeam.name: Scott Lehrer and Peter John Still

shows.title: A Doll's House
shows.synopsis: Nora Helmer's seemingly perfect life as a 19th-century housewife is upended when she is forced to confront the harsh realities of her marriage and the societal constraints that have long defined her. As Nora's facade begins to crumble, she must make a bold decision that will forever alter the course of her life and challenge the very foundations of her society. "A Doll's House" is a gripping exploration of personal freedom, gender roles, and the power of self-determination.

shows.title: Parade
shows.synopsis: "Parade" tells the gripping true story of the 1913 trial of Leo Frank, a Jewish factory manager accused of murdering a young girl in Atlanta. As the trial unfolds, the community's antisemitism and political tensions threaten to tear the city apart. With soaring melodies and a powerful narrative, this Tony-winning musical explores the pursuit of justice and the human cost of prejudice in early 20th-century America.

creativeTeam.name: Lauren Yalango-Grant and Christopher Cree Grant
Don Sebesky and Jason Robert Brown

shows.title: Bob Fosse's Dancin'
shows.synopsis: "Bob Fosse's Dancin'" takes audiences on a mesmerizing journey through the iconic choreographer's world. With a dazzling ensemble of dancers, the show explores the raw passion and unbridled energy of Fosse's groundbreaking style, blending jazz, ballet, and avant-garde movements into a captivating spectacle. From the sultry sways to the sharp, syncopated steps, the production celebrates the timeless allure of Fosse's legendary choreography, transporting viewers into the heart of the Broadway experience.

shows.title: Bad Cinderella
shows.synopsis: In the unconventional and enchanting world of "Bad Cinderella," a bold and unapologetic heroine challenges the traditional fairy tale. Embracing her own unique qualities, she navigates the complexities of a seemingly perfect kingdom, where she discovers that true beauty lies in embracing one's flaws and finding the courage to rewrite her own story. With a captivating blend of music, humor, and empowering themes, "Bad Cinderella" invites audiences on a delightfully subversive journey that redefines the fairy tale narrative.

shows.title: Sweeney Todd
shows.synopsis: Sweeney Todd, the infamous "Demon Barber of Fleet Street," returns to London seeking revenge against the judge who wrongfully imprisoned him. With the help of his resourceful neighbor, Mrs. Lovett, he opens a barbershop where he lures unsuspecting customers to their gruesome demise, the bodies of which Mrs. Lovett bakes into her famous meat pies. As Sweeney's thirst for vengeance grows, so too does the body count in this gripping, suspenseful musical thriller.

shows.title: Life of Pi
shows.synopsis: Trapped on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger, a young Indian boy named Pi must use his wits and courage to survive a harrowing journey across the vast Pacific Ocean. As they face treacherous storms and the constant threat of the tiger's power, Pi's resilience and his remarkable bond with the ferocious animal become the keys to his remarkable tale of perseverance and self-discovery.

shows.title: Shucked
shows.synopsis: "Shucked" takes audiences on a whimsical journey through the heart of rural America, where a quirky band of farmers and a city-slicker outsider team up to save their struggling corn farm. With a toe-tapping score and a cast of unforgettable characters, this heartwarming musical comedy celebrates the power of community, the magic of unexpected friendships, and the enduring spirit of the heartland.

shows.title: Fat Ham
shows.synopsis: In a modern adaptation of Shakespeare's Hamlet, "Fat Ham" follows Juicy, a young, queer Black man grappling with his uncle's sudden rise to power and the ghosts of his past. As Juicy navigates love, grief, and the complexities of family, he must confront the demons that haunt him and decide the fate of his family's legacy. With humor, heart, and a unique twist on a classic tale, "Fat Ham" explores the universal struggles of identity, betrayal, and the power of reclaiming one's own narrative.

shows.title: Camelot
shows.synopsis: In the enchanting realm of Camelot, a young King Arthur and his Queen Guinevere navigate the complexities of love and loyalty, as they strive to create a just and peaceful kingdom. However, their idyllic world is shattered by the arrival of the dashing Sir Lancelot, igniting a passionate triangle that threatens to tear the kingdom apart. With sweeping musical numbers and a timeless tale of love, honor, and betrayal, "Camelot" transports audiences to a legendary era of chivalry and enchantment.

creativeTeam.name: Robert Russell Bennett and Philip J. Lang

shows.title: Peter Pan Goes Wrong
shows.synopsis: The Darling family's attempt to stage a production of "Peter Pan" goes hilariously awry in "Peter Pan Goes Wrong." As the play-within-a-play spirals out of control, the hapless amateur actors confront a series of increasingly chaotic technical mishaps and personal calamities that threaten to derail the entire performance. Filled with slapstick comedy and gut-busting laughter, this riotous theatrical experience immerses the audience in the chaotic behind-the-scenes chaos of a production teetering on the brink of disaster.

shows.title: The Thanksgiving Play
shows.synopsis: In a hilarious blend of satire and social commentary, "The Thanksgiving Play" follows a group of well-meaning but misguided educators as they attempt to stage a politically correct Thanksgiving play. Navigating the minefield of cultural sensitivities and personal agendas, the characters hilariously clash, exposing the complexities and contradictions inherent in their efforts to represent the holiday in an inclusive and respectful manner. The play offers a biting, yet compassionate, exploration of the challenges of navigating modern-day societal divides.

shows.title: Prima Facie
shows.synopsis: "Prima Facie" is a gripping legal drama that delves into the complexities of the justice system. Tessa, a brilliant young barrister, navigates the challenging terrain of a high-profile case, where her unwavering belief in the law is tested by a shocking personal experience. As she grapples with the ethical dilemmas that arise, Tessa's world is turned upside down, forcing her to confront the very foundations of her profession and her own identity.

shows.title: Good Night, Oscar
shows.synopsis: "Good Night, Oscar" transports audiences to the tumultuous world of 1950s television, where the brilliant but unpredictable Oscar Levant navigates the pressures of fame and his own inner demons. As he prepares for a live TV appearance, Levant's wit, musical talents, and personal struggles collide in a captivating exploration of the price of genius and the power of the human spirit.

creativeTeam.name: Carolina Ortiz Herrera and Ben Stanton

shows.title: Summer, 1976
shows.synopsis: "Summer, 1976" transports audiences to a pivotal moment in history, as a group of friends navigate the social and political upheaval of the era. Amidst the backdrop of a changing America, the play explores themes of identity, community, and the power of personal transformation. With its captivating characters and timely narrative, "Summer, 1976" promises a poignant and thought-provoking theatrical experience.

shows.title: New York, New York
shows.synopsis: In the vibrant heart of New York City, a captivating story unfolds, where the dreams of aspiring artists collide with the relentless pursuit of success. Amidst the dazzling lights and pulsing rhythms of the city that never sleeps, two talented individuals embark on a journey of self-discovery, navigating the challenges and triumphs that come with chasing their artistic passions. "New York, New York" invites audiences on a thrilling exploration of the human spirit, set against the backdrop of the world's most iconic metropolis.

shows.title: The Sign in Sidney Brustein's Window
shows.synopsis: In "The Sign in Sidney Brustein's Window," a complex web of relationships and ideologies collide in 1950s Greenwich Village. As Sidney Brustein navigates his unconventional marriage and the ever-changing social landscape, he grapples with questions of identity, political activism, and the pursuit of personal fulfillment. Amidst the backdrop of a vibrant and bohemian community, the play explores the challenges of staying true to one's convictions in the face of societal pressures and personal compromises.

shows.title: Pass Over
shows.synopsis: In "Pass Over," two young Black men, Moses and Kitch, engage in a thought-provoking and often humorous dialogue as they navigate the harsh realities of life on the streets. Trapped in a cycle of violence and oppression, they dream of a promised land where they can finally find freedom and escape their bleak circumstances. As the play unfolds, it explores timely issues of race, inequality, and the struggle for justice, delivering a powerful and poignant theatrical experience.

shows.title: Waitress
shows.synopsis: Jenna, a small-town waitress and expert pie maker, is trapped in an unhappy marriage. When an unexpected pregnancy and a pie-baking contest offer her a chance at a new life, Jenna must find the courage to confront her past and forge her own path to happiness. With an irresistible score and a poignant story of empowerment, "Waitress" takes audiences on a heartwarming journey of self-discovery.

creativeTeam.name: Sara Bareilles and The Waitress Band

shows.title: Lackawanna Blues
shows.synopsis: "Lackawanna Blues" transports audiences to 1950s Buffalo, where a young boy navigates a vibrant, eclectic community centered around the boarding house run by his loving, yet unconventional caregiver, Miss Rachel. Through a kaleidoscope of dynamic characters, this deeply personal story explores the transformative power of human connection and the resilience of the human spirit.

shows.title: Chicken & Biscuits
shows.synopsis: The Jenkins family gathers for their patriarch's funeral, but old tensions and new secrets threaten to tear them apart. As they navigate their differences, the family discovers the power of forgiveness and the importance of cherishing their connection, even in the face of adversity. "Chicken & Biscuits" is a heartwarming and hilarious exploration of family, legacy, and the enduring bonds that hold us together.

shows.title: Is This a Room
shows.synopsis: In "Is This a Room," the audience is thrust into a tense interrogation as a young intelligence analyst is visited by the FBI. As the agents delve into her personal life, a gripping cat-and-mouse game unfolds, where the stakes are higher than anyone could have imagined. This riveting theatrical experience challenges preconceptions and explores the line between national security and individual rights in a powerful, thought-provoking manner.

shows.title: Thoughts of a Colored Man
shows.synopsis: "Thoughts of a Colored Man" takes the audience on a captivating journey, exploring the diverse experiences and perspectives of seven Black men navigating the complexities of life in modern-day Brooklyn. Through a tapestry of poetic monologues and powerful dialogues, the play delves into the emotional, social, and cultural tapestry that shapes the lives of these individuals, revealing the universal truths that unite us all.

creativeTeam.name: Toni-Leslie James and Devario D. Simmons

shows.title: The Lehman Trilogy
shows.synopsis: The Lehman Trilogy chronicles the remarkable rise and fall of the Lehman brothers, whose small dry goods store in Alabama evolves into a global financial powerhouse. Spanning over a century, this captivating drama follows three generations as they navigate the ever-changing landscape of American capitalism, ultimately leading to the collapse of their family's renowned investment firm. Audiences are immersed in an epic tale of ambition, greed, and the human cost of pursuing the American Dream.

shows.title: Dana H.
shows.synopsis: "Dana H." is a riveting, true-life drama that follows the harrowing ordeal of a woman held captive by a violent ex-patient. Told entirely through verbatim transcripts, the play immerses the audience in Dana's own words as she recounts her shocking five-month ordeal, painting a gripping and powerful portrait of survival. This haunting theatrical experience blurs the line between fact and fiction, challenging the audience's perceptions and emotions in a way that is both unsettling and profoundly moving.

shows.title: Caroline, or Change
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: "Caroline, or Change" is a captivating musical that explores the complex relationship between a young Jewish boy and his family's African-American housekeeper in 1960s Louisiana. As tensions rise during a time of social upheaval, the two form an unexpected bond that challenges their preconceptions and illuminates the enduring power of human connection. With a powerful score by Tony Kushner and Jeanine Tesori, this deeply moving story invites audiences to witness the transformative journey of lives intertwined.

creativeTeam.name: Rick Bassett, Joseph Joubert and Buryl Red

shows.title: Diana, The Musical
shows.synopsis: "Diana, The Musical" transports audiences into the private life of the iconic Princess Diana as she navigates the unforgiving spotlight of the British royal family. Tracing her meteoric rise to global fame, the musical delves into the complexities of her marriage, her personal struggles, and her transformative impact on the world. With stunning visuals and a powerful score, this captivating production offers a unique glimpse into the life of a beloved figure who forever changed the course of history.

shows.title: Trouble in Mind
shows.synopsis: In the groundbreaking Broadway production of "Trouble in Mind," a talented African American actress navigates the complex world of the theater, confronting racial prejudices and her own internal struggles. As she rehearses for a new play, she must confront the realities of a profession that often fails to recognize her humanity, leading to a powerful and thought-provoking exploration of the enduring legacy of racism in the arts. Audiences are captivated by this poignant and insightful drama that delves deep into the personal and professional lives of those fighting for their place on the stage.

shows.title: Clyde's
shows.synopsis: "Clyde's" is a gritty, high-stakes drama that takes place in the kitchen of a truck stop diner. A motley crew of ex-convicts, led by the tough-as-nails Clyde, fights for a chance at redemption as they strive to perfect their culinary craft and escape the cycle of recidivism. With razor-sharp dialogue and a pulsing undercurrent of hope, the play explores the complexities of second chances and the power of community in the face of adversity.

shows.title: Slave Play
shows.synopsis: "Slave Play" is a provocative exploration of race, sex, and power in America. Set on a modern-day plantation, the play follows three interracial couples who engage in a controversial form of therapy, delving into the complex legacies of slavery and their own personal relationships. With its bold and unflinching approach, "Slave Play" challenges audiences to confront the lingering effects of the past and the ways in which they shape the present.

shows.title: Company
shows.synopsis: "Company" follows the life of Robert, a single man navigating the complexities of relationships and marriage in New York City. On the eve of his 35th birthday, Robert's married friends attempt to set him up, leading him to confront his own commitment issues and the desire for a meaningful connection. With Stephen Sondheim's iconic score and a witty, insightful script, "Company" offers a poignant and humorous exploration of the joys and challenges of modern life.

shows.title: Flying Over Sunset
shows.synopsis: "Flying Over Sunset" invites audiences on a captivating journey, exploring the lives of three cultural icons - Aldous Huxley, Clare Boothe Luce, and Cary Grant - as they experiment with the mind-altering drug LSD in 1950s California. Blending dazzling musical numbers with thought-provoking themes, the show delves into the intersections of creativity, spirituality, and the pursuit of self-discovery, offering a one-of-a-kind theatrical experience that challenges and enchants.

shows.title: Skeleton Crew
shows.synopsis: In the heart of Detroit's auto industry, four factory workers face an uncertain future as the plant teeters on the brink of closure. As tensions rise and loyalties are tested, they must navigate the complexities of their relationships and the changing tides of economic upheaval. "Skeleton Crew" is a poignant and gripping exploration of the human cost of survival in the face of dwindling opportunities.

shows.title: The Music Man
shows.synopsis: "The Music Man" follows the mischievous Harold Hill, a con man who arrives in a small Iowa town, promising to form a boys' marching band and sell them instruments and uniforms. As he begins to charm the townspeople, including the prim and proper Marian the Librarian, his scheme starts to unravel, leading to a heartwarming and hilarious conclusion that celebrates the power of music and community.

shows.title: Plaza Suite
shows.synopsis: Three interconnected stories unfold in the iconic Plaza Hotel suite, revealing the complexities of marriage, relationships, and the human condition. From a long-married couple confronting their past to a groom-to-be's encounter with his high school flame, "Plaza Suite" offers a hilarious and poignant exploration of the joys and challenges that arise within the confines of a single hotel room.

shows.title: Paradise Square
shows.synopsis: In the vibrant heart of 19th-century New York City, the Irish-Black community of Paradise Square faces a turbulent era of change and upheaval. As tensions rise and the Civil War looms, a diverse group of residents come together through the power of music and dance, weaving a tapestry of cultures and creating a sanctuary of hope and unity amidst the chaos. Told through a captivating blend of musical styles, "Paradise Square" invites audiences on an unforgettable journey of self-discovery, resilience, and the transformative power of community.

creativeTeam.name: Bill T. Jones , Gelan Lambert and Chloe Davis
Christina Anderson, Craig Lucas and Larry Kirwan
Christina Anderson , Craig Lucas and Larry Kirwan

shows.title: Beetlejuice
shows.synopsis: In the quirky supernatural comedy "Beetlejuice", a recently deceased young woman named Lydia discovers the mischievous and outrageous bio-exorcist Beetlejuice, who promises to help her connect with the other side. But when Beetlejuice's antics spiral out of control, Lydia and her family must find a way to stop him before he takes over the living world. With its wild visuals, infectious music, and a devilishly funny lead character, "Beetlejuice" is a wild, irreverent ride that will leave audiences thoroughly entertained.

shows.title: Birthday Candles
shows.synopsis: "Birthday Candles" invites audiences on a captivating journey through one woman's lifetime, as she navigates the joys, sorrows, and transformations that shape her existence. From her childhood to her golden years, Ernestine grapples with the ebb and flow of life, finding solace in the ritual of blowing out her birthday candles year after year. Audiences are drawn into a poignant exploration of time, identity, and the enduring power of human resilience.

shows.title: American Buffalo
shows.synopsis: In "American Buffalo," three men hatch a plan to steal a rare and valuable coin from a local collector. As they navigate the complexities of their scheme, tensions rise and loyalties are tested in this gritty and intense exploration of the American dream. With its powerful performances and gripping narrative, this Tony-nominated play offers a captivating glimpse into the underbelly of small-town America.

shows.title: The Minutes
shows.venue: Harold and Miriam Steinberg Center for Theatre
shows.synopsis: "The Minutes" takes audiences on a gripping journey, unraveling the mysteries hidden within a small-town city council meeting. As tensions rise and secrets unravel, the seemingly mundane proceedings become a captivating exploration of power, corruption, and the fragility of community. With sharp dialogue and a compelling ensemble, this thought-provoking play challenges audiences to question the very foundations of their society.

shows.title: How I Learned to Drive
shows.synopsis: In "How I Learned to Drive," a woman navigates the complexities of her relationship with her uncle, who was her driving instructor and also her abuser. As she recounts the memories of her past, she confronts the lasting impact of her trauma and the power dynamics that shaped her coming of age. This Pulitzer Prize-winning play offers a poignant and thought-provoking exploration of the human experience, challenging the audience to grapple with the nuances of personal growth and the profound effects of abuse.

shows.title: for colored girls who have considered suicide / when the rainbow is enuf
shows.synopsis: "for colored girls who have considered suicide / when the rainbow is enuf" is a powerful and poetic theatrical experience that explores the joys, struggles, and resilience of Black women. Through a series of interconnected monologues, the play delves into themes of identity, love, and the strength that emerges from even the darkest of times. This acclaimed work by Ntozake Shange is a profound and moving celebration of the human spirit, inviting audiences to bear witness to the extraordinary stories of a diverse group of women.

shows.title: Hangmen
shows.synopsis: In a small English town in 1965, the impending abolition of capital punishment sends shockwaves through the local community. As the town's former executioner grapples with his identity and purpose, a mysterious stranger arrives, sparking a tense and thrilling confrontation that unravels dark secrets and forces everyone to confront their own moral compass. Hangmen is a gripping, darkly comedic exploration of power, justice, and the consequences of our actions.

shows.title: Funny Girl
shows.synopsis: Fanny Brice, a young Jewish woman with an extraordinary talent, dreams of becoming a star. As she rises to fame and success on the stage, her tumultuous relationship with her charming but unreliable husband, Nick Arnstein, takes center stage, leading to a bittersweet journey of love, ambition, and the relentless pursuit of the limelight.

shows.title: The Skin of Our Teeth
shows.synopsis: "The Skin of Our Teeth" is a captivating exploration of the human experience, spanning the dawn of time to the present day. Following the Antrobus family, this Pulitzer Prize-winning play by Thornton Wilder weaves a surreal tapestry of survival, evolution, and the indomitable spirit of humanity as they face the constant cycle of disaster and rebirth. Blending elements of comedy, tragedy, and the metaphysical, this innovative theatrical experience invites audiences on a thought-provoking journey through the timeless struggles and triumphs that define the human condition.

shows.title: A Strange Loop
shows.synopsis: Intimately explores the life of a queer Black man navigating self-doubt, societal pressures, and the cacophony of voices in his head. With raw honesty and biting humor, the story follows Usher's journey of self-discovery as he grapples with his identity and the complexities of being a Black, gay man in America. A profound, genre-defying musical that delves into the nuances of the human experience.

shows.title: Mr. Saturday Night
shows.synopsis: Mr. Saturday Night tells the story of Buddy Young Jr., a once-famous comedian whose star has dimmed. As he grapples with the realities of an industry that has left him behind, Buddy must confront his complicated relationships with his family and his own legacy. With a score by the legendary composer and lyricist Billy Crystal, the musical offers a poignant and hilarious exploration of the triumphs and tragedies of a life in show business.

creativeTeam.name: Billy Crystal, Lowell Ganz and Babaloo Mandel
Billy Crystal , Lowell Ganz and Babaloo Mandel

shows.title: POTUS: Or, Behind Every Great Dumbass are Seven Women Trying to Keep Him Alive
shows.synopsis: "POTUS: Or, Behind Every Great Dumbass are Seven Women Trying to Keep Him Alive" is a riotous comedy that takes audiences behind the closed doors of the Oval Office. As the President finds himself embroiled in a deepening scandal, a group of powerful women – from the First Lady to the White House secretary – must navigate the chaos and preserve the status quo, all while dealing with the Commander-in-Chief's increasingly erratic behavior. With its sharp wit and unapologetic take on politics, this Broadway show promises a rollicking good time.

shows.title: Macbeth
shows.synopsis: In the dark and treacherous world of Shakespeare's "Macbeth," a brave Scottish general is tempted by his ambitious wife to seize the throne through a series of ruthless murders. As their thirst for power spirals out of control, they find themselves trapped in a web of deceit, betrayal, and the relentless pursuit of their own demise. With stunning visuals and powerful performances, this gripping adaptation of the classic tragedy explores the consequences of unchecked ambition and the corrosive effects of guilt.
